title: 2001 Northern Ford Premiership
text:
The 2001 Northern Ford Premiership season was the second tier of British <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> during the 2001 season. The competition featured nineteen teams, with <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> winning the Grand Final.
Championship.
The league was won by <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a>, who beat <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> in the Grand Final. The League Leaders <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> lost in the play-off semi-finals. Widnes Vikings were promoted to the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
Play-offs.
Week 1.
Dewsbury Rams 6–19 Hull Kingston Rovers
Featherstone Rovers 28–24 Keighley Cougars
Leigh Centurions 14–15 Oldham
Widnes Vikings 34–24 Rochdale Hornets
Week 2.
Leigh Centurions 26–10 Featherstone Rovers
Rochdale Hornets 26–14 Hull Kingston Rovers
Week 3.
Leigh Centurions 18–26 Widnes Vikings
Oldham 39–32 Rochdale Hornets
